item.title: My Journey to eJPTv2 Certification
item.description:
I’ve always had a fascination with penetration testing, information gathering, and enumeration. There’s something thrilling about delving into the intricacies of a system, discovering its vulnerabilities, and ultimately strengthening its defenses. But for me, it’s more than just a passion; it’s a way of life.

Embracing Control and Privacy

One of the driving forces behind my interest in penetration testing is my love for self-hosting personal services. I’m a firm believer in having control over my data and privacy. Whether it’s my email server, cloud storage, or even my personal website, I prefer to manage these services myself. It allows me to ensure that my data remains mine and is not at the mercy of third-party providers. Most of the time…

item.title: The Power of Preparedness: Why a UPS is a Lifesaver for Home Servers
item.description:
The Power of Preparedness: Why a UPS is a Lifesaver for Home Servers

Lessons from a Power Outage Misadventure

We’ve all heard the saying, “With great power comes great responsibility.” But what about, “With great server hosting comes great problems”? As home server enthusiasts, we embark on a journey filled with excitement and challenges, seeking the thrill of managing our own services. However, yesterday’s power outage served as a poignant reminder that hosting our own services also means hosting our own problems. Enter the unsung hero of the day: the Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS).

item.title: NixOS: Revolutionizing Linux through Reproducibility and Unbreakable Configuration
item.description:
In the vast realm of Linux distributions, NixOS emerges as a game-changer, defying conventional practices with its novel approach to system configuration and package management. It champions declarative configuration, ensuring atomic upgrades, and employs content-addressable package management for unparalleled reproducibility and system integrity.

Declarative Configuration for Unbreakable Systems

At the core of NixOS lies the concept of declarative system configuration. This paradigm shift empowers users to define their system’s desired state using a single configuration file. This file encapsulates everything from software packages to network settings, all expressed in a functional language. This approach guarantees that changes are reversible, transparent, and free from interference with the current system state. This design fosters system resilience, enabling rapid recovery from issues and uniform behavior across various installations.

item.title: Audio over GIFs
